an5.211:1.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant who abuses and insults their spiritual companions, speaking ill of the noble ones, can expect these five drawbacks.
an5.211:1.3: They’re expelled, cut off, shut out; or they commit a corrupt offense; or they contract a severe illness. They feel lost when they die. And when their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an5.211:1.4: A mendicant who abuses and insults their spiritual companions, speaking ill of the noble ones, can expect these five drawbacks.”
